intro: Biscutella laevigata proles nicaeensis, commonly known as the Nicaean biscuit flower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard and cress species. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
